biography.value:
Evokers harness arcane energy to destroy. Many armies employ evokers to rain destruction down on enemy forces.

Wizards

Wizards pursue magical power through the study of arcane texts. Some travel the world searching for esoteric tomes, while others train lesser wizards or collaborate with colleagues to create new spells.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The evoker makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 4d10 + @mod type=force average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The evoker unleashes a magical explosion of a particular damage type: &Reference[cold]{cold}, &Reference[fire]{fire}, &Reference[lightning]{lightning}, or &Reference[thunder]{thunder}. The magic erupts in a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on a point within 150 feet of the evoker. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save dex 15 format=long]]. The evoker can select up to three creatures it can see in the area to ignore the explosion, as the evoker sculpts the energy around them. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 9d8 average=true]] damage of the chosen type and is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The evoker casts one of the following spells, using &Reference[int]{Intelligence} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

At will: light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation

2/day each: ice storm, &Reference[lightning]{lightning} bolt, mage armor

1/day: wall of ice

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw to avoid the spell.

A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks the spell. The spell doesn't have to follow a straight &Reference[line]{line} and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

materials.value: a short piece of copper wire

description.value:
This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
  • You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
  • You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
  • You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving &Reference[material]{material} for 1 hour.
  • You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
  • You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.


If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

A hail of rock-hard ice pounds to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} centered on a point within range. Each creature in the &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A creature takes 2d8 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage and 4d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Hailstones turn the storm's area of effect into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

materials.value: a pinch of dust and a few drops of water

description.value:
A stroke of &Reference[lightning]{lightning} forming a &Reference[line]{line} 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the &Reference[line]{line} must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 &Reference[lightning]{lightning} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The &Reference[lightning]{lightning} ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: a bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass

description.value: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical &Reference[force]{force} surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

You create a wall of ice on a solid surface within range. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a &Reference[sphere]{sphere} with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-square panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1 foot thick and lasts for the duration.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature within its area is pushed to one side of the wall and must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. It has AC 12 and 30 hit points per 10-foot section, and it is vulnerable to &Reference[fire]{fire} damage. Reducing a 10-foot section of wall to 0 hit points destroys it and leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. A creature moving through the sheet of frigid air for the first time on a turn must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. That creature takes 5d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage the wall deals when it appears increases by 2d6, and the damage from passing through the sheet of frigid air increases by 1d6, for each slot level above 6th.

system.chatFlavor: [5d6 - cold] Damage from passing through the wall; Constitution saving throw for half damage
